snippet.title: The Sudoku World Tour
snippet.description:
*** Today's Sudoku***

Today we embark on a World Tour courtesy of starwarigami who reimagines travel using Whisper lines!  This is really creative and gorgeous puzzle.  

You can play it at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/PtD46JNLTP

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply.  Travel around the world following the international whisper lines from Berlin to Moscow. The arrival hall at each airport (red) tells you the minimum difference between digits along the next leg of the journey, starting from the departure lounge (green).  A terminal with a white control tower must contain consecutive digits. A black control tower indicates the digits are in a ratio of 1:2.

** Join The Best Sudoku Club On Earth **
You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month here:  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

Loads of extra puzzles and videos are available here.  Currently we have December's monthly reward which is a four-puzzle sudoku hunt called Mexican Standoff.  We also have Simon and Mark's video on jovi_al's recent classic sudoku "Negativity".

▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀

It's OUT on Windows (released yesterday!) via Steam here:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1706870/Svens_SudokuPad/

You can now input your own classic sudoku puzzles into our software using our new App!  The app also comes with 12 handmade puzzles from us and we're also releasing occasional bonus puzzles too.  Already available on IOS and Android.

*** Our Book ***
The PDF is available as of today and the physical copy shouldn't be far behind.  If you don't own the book then it can still be ordered here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits/

snippet.title: If You Had To Solve This To Survive, What Would You Do?!
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is one of the most incredible sudokus we've ever seen.  It's a debut on the channel for FinnishGuy and it's called Palindromaze.  And if, Squid Game-style, you had to solve this to survive, what would your strategy be?!  You can play the puzzle at the following link: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/DnhfRLQ8FF

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages, digits must sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage. Grey lines in the grid are palindromes, which must read the same forwards and backwards. The clue outside the grid gives the sum of the digits along the indicated diagonal.  Digits can repeat along the diagonal if allowed by other rules. Cells separated by a white dot must contain consecutive digits.  Cells separated by a black dot must be in a 1:2 ratio.  Not all possible dots are given. Cells with a grey circle contain an odd digit.

*** Our Patreon - The Best Sudoku Club In The World *** 
You can join us on Patreon for as little as $2/month and access a lot of extra content.  Recent Patreon specials include Simon solving a Botaku sudoku (Euclidean Sudoku), the Lockout Lines Sudoku Hunt and Mark solving a recent Listener crossword by Enigmatist.  There's also a free bonus pack of Japanese Sum Sudoku Extravaganza from Panthera and TheAsylm where every puzzle creates a picture!  And at the start of November there's a 45 puzzle sudoku hunt exclusively made up of these puzzles!!

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

▶ SUDOKU PAD - Our New App  ◀

snippet.title: A Sudoku To Troll Your Friends With!
snippet.description:
▶Today's Puzzle◀

Today's sudoku comes with a sad story about how Mark attempted it and failed.  It's by Aad van de Wetering and it's magnificent... although you might want to watch the start of the video before you try it... You can play the puzzle here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/R8fnf423Jd

Rules:    
Normal sudoku rules apply.  Cells separated by a knight’s move (in chess) cannot contain the same digit.  Along the thermometer digits must increase from the bulb end. The blue tetrominoes contain the same 4 digits.

**************************************************************

Congratulations to Clover, who Sam has chosen as the winner of the competition to solve his barbaric puzzle.  If you've not tried it, you can play it at the link here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/br7MDtjjHq

Rules:
Normal sudoku rules apply. In cages digits sum to the small clue in the top left corner of the cage.  Digits cannot repeat in a cage.  Clues outside the grid give the sum of the cells on the indicated diagonal. Digits may repeat along the diagonal.

Sam has made a video demonstrating the solution path to the puzzle, which patrons of the channel can watch here:

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

snippet.title: This Sudoku Will Make You Laugh!
snippet.description:
▶ KICKSTARTER LINK◀

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits?ref=docedl

After an amazing first couple of days, we have hit the target to make the book!  Now we just hope we can reach the stretch goals to include the new puzzles!!  Please help us get there if you can!

**********************************************************************

▶Today's Puzzle◀


It's rare to come across sudokus that are genuinely witty but berni has done just that!  You can play the puzzle here:


https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/L8jmdmmJP8


Rules: 


Normal sudoku rules apply.  If there is a V between two cells, the sum of the digits in the cells has to be 5. If there is an X between two cells, the sum of the digits in the cells has to be 10. If there is no sign between two cells, neither of the two properties above holds. All hints are "knapp daneben", that is, they are one before or one after the symbol, that should be there. 



**************************************************************

Our Patreon page has lots of extra content including Scott Strosahl's Puzzle Hunt and Phistomefel's latest sudoku!

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

snippet.title: "Trick Or Treat" Sudoku!
snippet.description:
▶ KICKSTARTER LINK◀

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits?ref=docedl

Thanks to everyone who has helped with our Kickstarter Campaign to create the greatest sudoku book in history.  Check out tonight's NEW stretch goals! Please support us if you can and please remember to vote for the 10 puzzles you'd like to see in the book (you can do this on kickstarter).

**********************************************************************

▶Today's Puzzle◀

Happy Halloween!  Today's sudoku is another wonderful thematic affair from Ricky Cruz - "Trick Or Treat".  You can play it here:


https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/MLPrTD2pB6


Rules:  (Note that there are some fantastic thematic rules below but it might be easier if you're solving in our software to use the formal rules, which come first.)    


Formal rules: 

Normal sudoku rules apply.  Cells separated by a single knight's move (in chess) cannot contain the same digit.  Create a one-cell wide path in the grid to form a single loop that starts and ends in the central cell. The path must orthogonally touch each grey cell at least once but cannot enter any grey cell. The path cannot touch itself orthogonally. The central cell contains the lowest digit that can appear on the path. The path must visit each of the cells with a circle in them on them in strictly ascending order along the path (a cell is "visited" the first time the path orthogonally touches the cell). 


Flavourtext rules:
It's Halloween; time to plan your trick-or-treat route through the neighborhood!
Normal sudoku rules apply; you're a dragon for Halloween this year, and dragons don't like knights! So if two cells are a chess knight's move apart, they cannot have the same digit.
Create a one-cell wide path around the neighborhood that orthogonally touches every house at least once, starting and ending at your house in the center cell.
The path cannot touch itself orthogonally, and cannot go through any house (except your house, of course). No cell on the path can be lower than the number in your house.
Finally, the houses that have candy on them must be visited along the path in strictly ascending order (a house is visited the first time the path orthogonally touches the house). It is up to you to determine in what direction the path runs.


**************************************************************

Our Patreon page has lots of extra content including Scott Strosahl's Puzzle Hunt and Phistomefel's latest sudoku!  Watch out for our new monthly bonus puzzle - coming on November 1st!

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

************************************************************************

snippet.title: How To Follow A Logical Thread
snippet.description:
Our book is very close to release - thanks to everyone who supported the Kickstarter.  If you still need to order it then you can do so here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/peterchayward/cracking-the-cryptics-greatest-hits

Ricky Cruz, the man who bought us Cluedo Sudoku and Frogger Sudoku, returns today with Stitches - sewing has never been so fun!  Give the puzzle a try at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/J2HhJ9Pb9t

Colourblind-friendlier version:  https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/NLFT84hb8g

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. On thermometers, digits increase from the bulb end. Digits linked by a blue thread sum to 6.  Digits linked by a purple thread sum to 14.  Repeats are allowed on the sum threads.

PS Thanks to everyone who joined Simon's livestream of The Witness last night!  Episode 4 should happen soon - probably Thursday evening - we'll announce it on Twitter (@crypticcracking).

PPS If we manage to reach 400,000 subscribers then we'll be releasing a video where Mark and Simon answer community questions!  Please email us at crackingthecryptic@gmail.com if you have a good question for them :)

▶ MORE PATREON MADNESS ◀
We've just released Heatwave, a set of incredible thermo sudokus by the astrophysicist grkles!  (Don't worry you don't need to be a rocket scientist to solve them!)  You can join us on Patreon here:

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

snippet.title: Frogger:  The Sudoku
snippet.description:
▶  NEW SUDOKU PUZZLE HUNT JUST OUT ◀
You can find our brand new sudoku hunt on Patreon now!  Can you unlock the secrets of the Wonders Of The World?!!  

https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

*********************************************************************
We declare today's puzzle is perfect:  it's beautiful-looking, it uses the theme wonderfully and it's a really fun solve  Ricky Cruz has done it again and you can play his Frogger Sudoku here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/p27QN9Ldtj

Rules: 
It's time to hit the arcade! In this grid, you need to take Frogger across the road and the river to reach one of the coloured frogs at the top of the screen.

Normal sudoku rules apply. In addition, there is an orthogonally-connected path starting at Frogger (R9C5) that collects all flies in the grid and ends at one of the colored frogs (small circles) in the first row. The path cannot touch itself orthogonally, but can touch itself diagonally. The path also cannot go through the bushes (green cells) in the first row.

Cars and logs are found in the road and the river, respectively; they appear in those regions wherever two horizontally adjacent digits sum to 10. Frogger cannot go through cars, and can only hop across logs in the river.

▶ SIMON VS PHISTOMEFEL◀
If you'd like to try the Phistomefel Yin-Yang Fillomino you can play it here:

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/49gg9R9jT6

Rules and example puzzle can be found here:
https://logic-masters.de/Raetselportal/Raetsel/zeigen.php?id=00053V

A video of Simon battling against this puzzle is available on Patreon now.

Please follow us on Twitter: @crypticcracking

**************************************************************

snippet.title: We Expose The Sudoku Murderer!
snippet.description:
Today's puzzle is called CluedoKu, a mash-up of Cluedo and Sudoku, by Ricky Cruz.  Two of the suspects look familiar...  Can you find out who committed the crime?  Play the puzzle here:


https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/webapp/jh6RDHdBmq


Rules: 

[Note the puzzle can be treated in two ways:  As a normal sudoku (Formal Rules below) or as the murder mystery (Flavourtext rules below).]


Flavourtext rules: 

Welcome to Sudoku Manor, where normal sudoku rules apply! Along thermometers, digits must increase from the bulb... except for the digit in the central cell of the grid which is "broken", meaning its thermo functions without that digit but not with it.  (The broken cell may therefore repeat a digit from elsewhere on that thermo.) The murder occurred in one of the six 3x3 "rooms" (the upper and lower 3x3 boxes). The thermos in these rooms represent the six weapons, each of which is identified by the number in the center of its room. The six suspects are gathered in the centre room, represented by the colored cells. Each suspect's cell contains a number corresponding to one of the weapons; this shows which room each suspect was in at the time of the murder. The number in the broken cell of the central thermo is the key to discovering the killer; the killer was in the only room where the highest digit on that room's thermo equals the broken cell (other rooms' thermos are allowed to share highest digits). Can you crack this cryptic case?


Normal rules:
Normal sudoku rules apply. Along thermometers, digits must increase from the bulb. The marked square on the central thermo is "broken", meaning the thermo functions without that digit, but not with it. The broken cell may repeat a digit from elsewhere on the thermo. The center squares of the upper and lower 3x3 boxes contain all of the digits in the coloured squares of the central 3x3 box. The digit in the broken square of the central thermo is equal to the highest digit of exactly one of the other six thermos.


The Weapons (listed in ascending order of weapon numbers!):
Candlestick
Dagger
Lead Pipe
Revolver
Rope
Wrench


**************************************************************

Our Patreon page has lots of extra content including Scott Strosahl's Puzzle Hunt, which was released this afternoon!  You'll also find our solve of Cosmology by Bobuardo Da Vinci!


https://www.patreon.com/crackingthecryptic

************************************************************************

We hope we can help your puzzle solving while also introducing you to some of the world's best puzzles.

Thank you for watching!
Simon and Mark

snippet.title: Enjoy A Sudoku Bubble Bath!
snippet.description:
▶ OUR NEW ARROW SUDOKU APP IS OUT ON ALL PLATFORMS!
Here are the links:
Steam:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1613680/Arrow_Sudoku/
App Store:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/arrow-sudoku/id1568407537
Google Play:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.StudioGoya.ArrowSudoku

*********************************************************************
Today's puzzle is by the super-talented constructor/artist Ricky Cruz and all you need to do to solve it is submerge yourself in his Bubble Bath!  You can play the puzzle at the link below: 

https://app.crackingthecryptic.com/sudoku/G9mBNJr24F

Rules: 
Normal sudoku rules apply. Digits inside grey bubbles must be odd.  Digits separated by a white bubble are consecutive.  Digits separated by a black bubble have a ratio of 1:2.  Not all bubbles are given.

▶ NEW HITCHHIKER'S GUIDE TO THE GALAXY SUDOKU HUNT! ◀
We've released a sudoku hunt themed on The Hitchhiker's Guide To The Galaxy as our monthly Patreon reward for June.  Remember that we will also be releasing a new Murder Mystery Sudoku Hunt for everybody if we reach 5000 patrons.
